news_header: A professional shoplifting gang, known as the 'champagne gang', has stolen over £73,000 worth of goods from UK supermarkets using organized tactics and communication technology.
news_text: The BBC has uncovered the tactics of a sophisticated shoplifting gang in the UK that has stolen at least £73,000 worth of goods, primarily champagne. Operating in groups of three, they use Bluetooth headsets for communication and blend in with shoppers while stealing. The gang, originating from Romania, has a structured hierarchy and has adapted their methods in response to retail security measures. They have been linked to 60 incidents across the UK and are part of a larger trend of organized retail crime, which has significantly impacted the cost of living for consumers. Retailers report feeling vulnerable to these gangs, and while some arrests have been made, many suspects evade prosecution and return to their home countries with stolen goods.
